summary: This document is a series of email correspondences between legal counsel and the court regarding the case US v. Maxwell. It concerns a motion to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena, requests for oral argument, and the submission of documents under temporary seal ahead of a final pre-trial conference.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge presiding over the case US v. Maxwell, whose chambers are receiving and issuing orders on the motion to quash.

persons.name: R. Smith
persons.context: Attorney submitting a letter on behalf of the defendant M. (Ghislaine Maxwell) regarding document production under temporary seal.

connections.description: R. Smith is submitting legal documents and correspondence on behalf of the defendant M. (Ghislaine Maxwell).
E., representing the prosecution, is opposing the defendant M. by filing a motion to quash her subpoena.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case US v. Maxwell involving the defendant M.

events.title: Final Pre-Trial Conference
events.description: A court conference scheduled where the prosecution inquired about hearing oral argument on the motion to quash.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Quash
events.description: The prosecution (E.) filed a motion to quash the defendant's Rule 17(c) subpoena, submitted under temporary seal with exhibits.

keyFacts: The prosecution filed a motion to quash a defense subpoena (Rule 17(c)) in the case US v. Maxwell.
Legal correspondence was submitted under temporary seal, indicating sensitive material.
A final pre-trial conference was scheduled for November 24, 2021, at 9:30 am.
The defense had not yet filed its response to the motion to quash as of November 22, 2021.
